Mission_Focus: Applied research in advanced materials for armor, structures, energetics, power, and survivability for ground forces.
Organic_Capabilities: Materials science labs, armor modeling, metallurgy, additive manufacturing, structural testing.
Outsourced_Capabilities: Specialty materials vendors, AM service bureaus, armor test ranges.
Transition_Path: BA2 → BA3 ground vehicle, soldier protection, and weapons ATDs → BA4/BA5 PoRs
Notes: Core Army S&T materials line; fill FY amounts from FY26 Army R-1 later.

Mission_Focus: ATDs for integrated night vision systems: fused I²/thermal imagers, panoramic goggles, weapon sights, and platform sensor packages.
Organic_Capabilities: System-level prototypes, soldier trials, platform integration tests.
Outsourced_Capabilities: NVG OEMs, optics suppliers, helmet/soldier system vendors, test ranges.
Transition_Path: BA2 night vision tech → BA3 night vision ATDs → BA4 ENVG/IVAS PoRs
Notes: Representative Army BA3 NVESD line; add real FY amounts from Army R-1.

Mission_Focus: Applied research into naval EW techniques, RF phenomenology, threat signal characterization, and EW materials for surface, subsurface, and air platforms.
Organic_Capabilities: EW labs, RF threat modeling, algorithm prototyping.
Outsourced_Capabilities: EW OEMs, RF vendors, university partners.
Transition_Path: BA2 EW S&T → BA3 SEWIP/autonomous EW ATDs → BA4 SEWIP and airborne EW systems
Notes: Template for Navy EW BA2 lines; map to exact PEs in Navy R-1.

PE_Name: Large/Medium Unmanned Surface Vehicle (USV) Advanced Technology
Mission_Focus: ATDs for large and medium USVs, focusing on autonomy, navigation, payload integration, and manned-unmanned teaming for distributed maritime operations.
Organic_Capabilities: Autonomy stack integration, hull/propulsion prototypes, MUM-T concepts.
Outsourced_Capabilities: Autonomy vendors, shipyards, combat system integrators.
Transition_Path: BA2 naval autonomy → BA3 USV ATDs → BA4 USV programs of record (LUSV/MUSV)
Notes: Represents USV ATD portfolio; link to real PEs when mapped.

PE_Name: Littoral Combat Ship (LCS) Mission Modules System Development
Mission_Focus: System development and demonstration for LCS mission modules (SUW, ASW, MCM) including sensors, weapons, and support systems.
Executing_Org: PEO USC / NSWC Panama City / NSWC Dahlgren
Organic_Capabilities: Mission system integration labs, at-sea test events.
Outsourced_Capabilities: Module OEMs, UUV/USV primes, sonar vendors, weapon suppliers.
Transition_Path: BA3 USV/MCM ATDs → BA4 LCS mission modules → BA7 surface warfare/mine warfare modernization
Notes: Use as anchor for LCS-related BA4; fill FY24–26 from Navy R-1.

Mission_Focus: Central management, planning, financial oversight, and portfolio governance for Navy RDT&E across all budget activities.
Organic_Capabilities: Requirements traceability, program review, budget build, portfolio analysis.
Outsourced_Capabilities: FFRDCs, analytic contractors, budget/PPBE support firms.
Transition_Path: Supports all Navy BA2–BA7 lines; not a TRL-carrying program.
Notes: Pure infrastructure/management; influences gate probabilities rather than TRLs.

PE_Name: AEGIS Combat System Modernization (Baseline Upgrade Series)
Mission_Focus: Modernization of AEGIS baselines including software loads, sensor fusion upgrades, threat libraries, and missile integration.
Organic_Capabilities: Integration labs, combat system modeling, test harnesses.
Outsourced_Capabilities: Large primes (Lockheed), software integrators, threat-model providers.
Transition_Path: BA4/BA5 combat system builds → BA7 modernization → Fleet deployment
Notes: Template BA7 line; link to real PE once mapped from R-1.

Mission_Focus: Applied research in advanced aerospace composites, high-temperature materials, fatigue modeling, coatings, and structures for air and space systems.
Organic_Capabilities: Materials science labs, fatigue rigs, coatings prototypes, coupon testing.
Outsourced_Capabilities: Advanced materials OEMs, university labs, aerospace suppliers.
Transition_Path: BA2 materials S&T → BA3 airframe/engine ATDs → BA4 platform engineering
Notes: Use Air Force R-1 to populate FY24–26 funding.

Mission_Focus: Applied research on high-energy laser materials, beam control, high-power microwave sources, thermal management, and optical components.
Organic_Capabilities: Laser benches, optical test facilities, HPM sources, modeling.
Outsourced_Capabilities: Optics vendors, DE OEMs, thermal subsystem integrators.
Transition_Path: BA2 DE science → BA3 DE demonstrators → BA4 DE prototype integration (airborne & ground)
Notes: Anchor for AF DE S&T; map to actual PE line in R-1.

PE_Name: SOF ISR & Strike UAS Advanced Technology
Sub_Org: PEO Fixed Wing / PEO SOF Warrior
Mission_Focus: ATDs for SOF-focused group 3+ UAS with enhanced ISR, low-signature strike, contested-environment comms, and austere operations support.
Organic_Capabilities: Mission-specific CONOPS, integration labs, flight experiments.
Outsourced_Capabilities: UAS primes, sensor vendors, comms integrators, small SOF-focused firms.
Transition_Path: BA2 SOF ISR/autonomy S&T → BA3 SOF UAS ATD → BA4/BA5 SOF ISR & strike platforms
Notes: Captures SOF-specific RDT&E that later interacts with service programs in your ABM.

Sub_Org: PEO SOF Digital Applications / PEO SOF Warrior
Mission_Focus: System development for SOF-tailored ISR suites including sensors, PED tools, data fusion, and multi-domain connectivity for AT/CT missions.
Organic_Capabilities: Operational CONOPS development, integration labs, field experimentation.
Outsourced_Capabilities: Cloud providers, PED vendors, comms OEMs, AI/ML companies.
Transition_Path: BA3 SOF ISR ATDs → BA4 Next-Gen SOF ISR System → BA7 SOF ISR modernization
Notes: Key node for SOCOM-service interoperability in ABM.

Organization: Office of the Secretary of Defense
Mission_Focus: Cross-service ATDs for trusted AI, human-machine teaming, verification & validation of AI for DoD C4ISR and weapon systems.
Organic_Capabilities: Portfolio-level experimentation, cross-service testbeds, V&V research.
Transition_Path: BA2 AI science (service labs) → BA3 OUSD(R&E) Trusted AI ATDs → BA4 service-specific system integration
Notes: Central cross-cutting AI node for the ABM to couple services’ RDT&E behavior.

Mission_Focus: ATDs for detection, interdiction, defeat, and consequence management of WMD threats, including sensors, modeling, and defeat mechanisms.
Organic_Capabilities: Specialized CBRN labs, modeling & simulation, field experiments.
Outsourced_Capabilities: Sensor OEMs, modeling firms, test ranges, academia.
Transition_Path: BA2 CBRN S&T → BA3 CWMD ATDs → BA4/BA5 integration with service CBRN PoRs
Notes: Acts as joint node feeding Army/Navy/AF CBRN programs in ABM.

Mission_Focus: Engineering and development of the Next Generation Interceptor, including propulsion, kill vehicle, guidance, and integration with BMDS sensors and fire control.
Organic_Capabilities: System engineering, integration labs, flight test planning.
Outsourced_Capabilities: Prime contractors, propulsion OEMs, seeker vendors, test ranges.
Transition_Path: BA3 BMD ATDs (sensors, discrimination, kill vehicle tech) → BA4 NGI → BA5/BA7 deployed BMDS increments
Notes: High-visibility BMDS node; useful in ABM shock scenarios and cross-portfolio coupling.
